climbs.name: Wrath Of St. Valentine, The
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Steve Parker, February 1993

content.description: This is an exciting and varied route, with interesting problem solving.  The crux is a shallow flared hand crack.  It is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
content.location: This is on the back side (west-facing) of the rib that contains "Grand Canyon Donkey Trail."  It is the right of two cracks.

climbs.name: For Peter
climbs.fa: Vaino Kodas, Herb Laeger, Eve Laeger 10/87

content.description:
Climb easy face to a horizontal dike.  Follow the dike left using heel hooks and hand holds to a strenuous mantle. Continue up past two bolts on thin face to the top.

I believe [the "R" rating] is justified because if you come off while doing the difficult mantle just under the 5th bolt (10 feet directly left of the 4th bolt) you will take a nasty pendulum and the rope may hit a sharp edge on a portion of the discontinuous dike.
content.protection:
6 bolts (all 3/8"), pro to 3" for anchors.

All 6 bolts were replaced 2/11/01 by the ASCA.
content.location:
Located directly across from the

Rubicon Formation

.

climbs.name: For Paul
climbs.fa: Frank Bentwood, Kelly Vaught, Rich Edelen

content.description: Starts on the left (south) side of the west face of Grand Canyon.  Go up past three bolts to a large dike.  Traverse left on the dike past six more bolts and exit on the slab and climb up to a bolted anchor above the climbs Love Stone and The Wrath of St. Valentine.
